description: Internet Information Services: Microsoft's extensible web server for Windows.

slides.title: What is IIS?
slides.content:
# The Windows Server ü™ü

**Internet Information Services.**

Built into Windows Server.

Deeply integrated with the Microsoft ecosystem (ASP.NET, Active Directory, SQL Server).

slides.title: Architecture
slides.content:
# Kernel Mode üèéÔ∏è

IIS runs partly in **Kernel Mode** (`http.sys`) for extreme speed in handling HTTP requests before they even reach user space.

This makes it very stable and fast on Windows.

slides.title: Application Pools
slides.content:
# Isolation üõ°Ô∏è

A critical concept.

Each website runs in its own **App Pool**.

If one site crashes (due to bad code), it does NOT bring down other sites on the server. They are separate processes (`w3wp.exe`).

slides.title: Management
slides.content:
# GUI & CLI üéõÔ∏è

- **IIS Manager:** Visual interface to configure everything.
- **PowerShell:** Automate everything.

`Import-Module WebAdministration; New-WebSite ...`

slides.title: Feature Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Which IIS feature ensures that a crash in one website does not affect others?

slides.title: Authentication
slides.content:
# Windows Auth üÜî

IIS shines here.

- **Anonymous:** Public access.
- **Windows Authentication:** Auto-login users on an Intranet utilizing Active Directory (Kerberos/NTLM).
- **Basic/Digest:** Simple prompts.

slides.title: ISAPI & Modules
slides.content:
# Extensibility üß©

IIS uses Modules (Native C++ or Managed .NET) to process requests.

- **StaticFileModule:** Serves images.
- **AspNetCoreModule:** Forwards requests to .NET Core apps.

slides.title: web.config
slides.content:
# Configuration üìÑ

XML file in the site root (similar to `.htaccess` but XML).

```xml
<configuration>
  <system.webServer>
    <rewrite>
      <rules>...</rules>
    </rewrite>
  </system.webServer>
</configuration>
```

slides.title: ARR (Application Request Routing)
slides.content:
# Load Balancer üß±

An extension that turns IIS into a Reverse Proxy and Load Balancer.

Allows IIS to forward traffic to other servers (even Linux ones).

slides.title: Security
slides.content:
# Request Filtering üö´

Built-in security module.

Can block specific file extensions (`.mdb`), URLs, or HTTP verbs.

Great for preventing SQL injection or protecting sensitive files.

slides.title: Config Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: What file format does IIS use for its configuration files (web.config)?

slides.title: Code Example
slides.content:
# web.config Redirect üíª

<!-- Redirect HTTP to HTTPS -->

 <system.webServer>
  <rewrite>
   <rules>
    <rule name="Redirect to HTTPS" stopProcessing="true">
     <match url="(.*)" />
     <conditions>
      <add input="{HTTPS}" pattern="^OFF$" />
     </conditions>
     <action type="Redirect" url="https://{HTTP_HOST}/{R:1}" redirectType="Permanent" />
    </rule>
   </rules>
  </rewrite>
 </system.webServer>
</configuration>

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Recap: IIS üéì

Windows Power.

- **Kernel Mode:** Fast http.sys.
- **App Pools:** Process isolation.
- **web.config:** XML configuration.
- **Windows Auth:** Intranet single sign-on.
- **Management:** GUI + PowerShell.
